title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table
name: Table
description: Tables are a standard two-dimensional table with individual records organized in rows, and a data type assigned to each column (also called a field).

params.name: connection
params.description: Represents a connection to BigQuery.

params.name: id
params.description: The table's id.

params.name: datasetId
params.description: The dataset's id.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The project's id.

params.name: mapper
params.description: Maps values between PHP and BigQuery.

params.name: info
params.description: The table's metadata.

params.name: location
params.description: A default geographic location, used when no table metadata exists.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check whether or not the table exists.

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete the table.

Please note that by default the library will not attempt to retry this call on your behalf.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update the table.

Providing an etag key as part of $metadata will enable simultaneous update protection. This is useful in preventing override of modifications made by another user. The resource's current etag can be obtained via a GET request on the resource.

Please note that by default the library will not automatically retry this call on your behalf unless an etag is set.

params.name: metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the Table Resource API docs

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: rows
methods.description: Retrieves the rows associated with the table and merges them together with the schema.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.startIndex
params.description: Zero-based index of the starting row.

methods.name: runJob
methods.description: Starts a job in an synchronous fashion, waiting for the job to complete before returning.

params.name: config
params.description: The job configuration.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to retry, checking if the job has completed. Defaults to 100.

methods.name: startJob
methods.description: Starts a job in an asynchronous fashion. In this case, it will be required to manually trigger a call to wait for job completion.

params.name: config
params.description: The job configuration.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Returns a copy job configuration to be passed to either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::runJob() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::startJob(). A configuration can be built using fluent setters or by providing a full set of options at once.

params.name: destination
params.description: The destination table.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see the [upstream API documentation for Job configuration] (https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs#configuration) for the available options.

methods.name: extract
methods.description: Returns an extract job configuration to be passed to either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::runJob() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::startJob(). A configuration can be built using fluent setters or by providing a full set of options at once.

params.name: destination
params.description: The destination object. May be a Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject or a URI pointing to a Google Cloud Storage object in the format of gs://{bucket-name}/{object-name}.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see the [upstream API documentation for Job configuration] (https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs#configuration) for the available options.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Returns a load job configuration to be passed to either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::runJob() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::startJob(). A configuration can be built using fluent setters or by providing a full set of options at once.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to load.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see the [upstream API documentation for Job configuration] (https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs#configuration) for the available options.

methods.name: loadFromStorage
methods.description: Returns a load job configuration to be passed to either Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::runJob() or Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::startJob(). A configuration can be built using fluent setters or by providing a full set of options at once.

params.name: object
params.description: The object to load data from. May be a Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject or a URI pointing to a Google Cloud Storage object in the format of gs://{bucket-name}/{object-name}.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see the [upstream API documentation for Job configuration] (https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs#configuration) for the available options.

methods.name: insertRow
methods.description:
Insert a record into the table without running a load job.

Please note that by default the library will not automatically retry this call on your behalf unless an insertId is set.

params.name: row
params.description: Key/value set of data matching the table's schema.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::insertRows() for the other available configuration options.

params.name: options.insertId
params.description: Used to ensure data consistency.

methods.name: insertRows
methods.description:
Insert records into the table without running a load job.

Please note that by default the library will not automatically retry this call on your behalf unless an insertId is set.

params.name: rows
params.description: The rows to insert. Each item in the array must contain a data key which is to hold a key/value array with data matching the schema of the table. Optionally, one may also provide an insertId key which will be used to ensure data consistency.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: Whether or not to attempt to automatically create the table in the case it does not exist. Please note, it will be required to provide a schema through $tableMetadata['schema'] in the case the table does not already exist. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.tableMetadata
params.description: Metadata to apply to table to be created. The full set of metadata are outlined at the Table Resource API docs. Only applies when autoCreate is true.

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of times to attempt creating the table in the case of failure. Please note, each retry attempt may take up to two minutes. Only applies when autoCreate is true. Defaults to 100.

params.name: options.skipInvalidRows
params.description: Insert all valid rows of a request, even if invalid rows exist. The default value is false, which causes the entire request to fail if any invalid rows exist. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.ignoreUnknownValues
params.description: Accept rows that contain values that do not match the schema. The unknown values are ignored. The default value is false, which treats unknown values as errors. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.templateSuffix
params.description: If specified, treats the destination table as a base template, and inserts the rows into an instance table named "{destination}{templateSuffix}". BigQuery will manage creation of the instance table, using the schema of the base template table. See Creating tables automatically using template tables for considerations when working with templates tables.

exceptions.description:
If a provided row does not contain a
        `data` key, if a schema is not defined when `autoCreate` is
        `true`, or if less than 1 row is provided.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Retrieves the table's details. If no table data is cached a network request will be made to retrieve it.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Triggers a network request to reload the table's details.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: identity
methods.description:
Retrieves the table's identity.

An identity provides a description of a nested resource.
